headline: 1 Stock Under $50 with Exciting Potential and 2 We Find Risky
summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

headline: Texas Instruments to buy chip designer Silicon Labs in $7.5 billion deal
summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories in a deal valuing the ​chip designer at $7.5 billion, expanding its footprint in ‌wireless connectivity chips used for industrial and consumer applications.  For Texas, whose core ‌strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.

content.title: Texas Instruments to buy chip designer Silicon Labs in $7.5 billion deal
content.summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories in a deal valuing the ​chip designer at $7.5 billion, expanding its footprint in ‌wireless connectivity chips used for industrial and consumer applications.  For Texas, whose core ‌strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.

headline: Silicon Labs Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
summary: Silicon Labs (NASDAQ: SLAB), a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology for a more connected world, reported financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025, which ended January 3, 2026.

content.title: Silicon Labs Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
content.summary: Silicon Labs (NASDAQ: SLAB), a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology for a more connected world, reported financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025, which ended January 3, 2026.

headline: Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs
summary: Texas Instruments (Nasdaq: TXN), a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and sells analog and embedded processing chips, and Silicon Labs (Nasdaq: SLAB), a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology, today announced they have signed a definitive agreement under which Texas Instruments will acquire Silicon Labs for $231.00 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.

content.title: Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs
content.summary: Texas Instruments (Nasdaq: TXN), a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and sells analog and embedded processing chips, and Silicon Labs (Nasdaq: SLAB), a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology, today announced they have signed a definitive agreement under which Texas Instruments will acquire Silicon Labs for $231.00 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.

headline: Texas Instruments to buy Silicon Labs, Enphase stock surges 40%
summary: Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Texas Instruments (TXN) purchasing Silicon Laboratories (SLAB) in a deal valued at $7.5 billion, Enphase Energy (ENPH) surging by over 40% on its fourth quarter earnings results, and Boston Scientific (BSX) shares dropping on its weak forecast. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Silicon Labs Stock Soars. Why Texas Instruments Is Paying a Big Premium for Acquisition.
summary: Texas Instruments  has agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories, a maker of mixed-signal chips used in smart homes, industrial automation, and commercial applications.  Texas Instruments will acquire  Silicon Labs  for $231 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.  Shares of Silicon Laboratories soared 51% to $206.73 in premarket trading Wednesday.

content.title: Silicon Labs Stock Soars. Why Texas Instruments Is Paying a Big Premium for Acquisition.
content.summary: Texas Instruments  has agreed to buy Silicon Laboratories, a maker of mixed-signal chips used in smart homes, industrial automation, and commercial applications.  Texas Instruments will acquire  Silicon Labs  for $231 per share in an all-cash transaction, representing a total enterprise value of approximately $7.5 billion.  Shares of Silicon Laboratories soared 51% to $206.73 in premarket trading Wednesday.

headline: Texas Instruments strikes $7.5 billion deal for Silicon Labs to boost wireless footprint
summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy chip designer Silicon Laboratories for about $7.5 billion, aiming to ​expand its presence in wireless connectivity chips used in industrial and ‌consumer applications.  For TI, whose core strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power ‌in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.  Unlike AI chip firms Nvidia and AMD, TI focuses on foundational chips used in everyday devices such as smartphones, cars and medical devices, giving ⁠it a large client ‌base that includes Apple, SpaceX and Ford.

content.title: Texas Instruments strikes $7.5 billion deal for Silicon Labs to boost wireless footprint
content.summary: Texas Instruments on Wednesday agreed to buy chip designer Silicon Laboratories for about $7.5 billion, aiming to ​expand its presence in wireless connectivity chips used in industrial and ‌consumer applications.  For TI, whose core strength lies in analog chips that manage signals and power ‌in electronic equipment, the acquisition marks its biggest since the $6.5 billion deal for National Semiconductor in 2011.  Unlike AI chip firms Nvidia and AMD, TI focuses on foundational chips used in everyday devices such as smartphones, cars and medical devices, giving ⁠it a large client ‌base that includes Apple, SpaceX and Ford.
